fields.description:
euca2ools 3.2.1 and 3.1.3 are maintenance releases slated to ship concurrently with eucalyptus 4.1.2.  The list of changes is as follows.  If I make further changes to it I will note so with comments in this bug.

h4. Changes in euca2ools 3.2.1 and euca2ools 3.1.3
* Images created by euca-bundle-image and that contain block device mappings should now function correctly in EC2.  (TOOLS-559)
* euare-accountgetsummary now accepts the --as-account option.  (TOOLS-554)
* euca-authorize and euca-revoke can now create and delete rules with arbitrary [IANA-assigned protocol numbers|http://www.iana.org/assignments/protocol-numbers/protocol-numbers.xhtml] as well as the special values "all" and "-1", which refer to all network traffic, in VPC security groups.  As a convenience, if a protocol is specified by name euca-authorize and euca-revoke will consult /etc/protocols to discover its number.  (TOOLS-560)
* euare-rolecreate --service is now read from the command line correctly.
* EC2 no longer requires special privileges to use euca-register's and euca-install-image's --virtualization-type options.  Those commands' documentation now reflects that.
* Account registration status will be removed from eucalyptus 4.2.  euare-usermod's documentation now reflects that.  (EUCA-9481)
* euca-upload-bundle's --skipmanifest option now works correctly. (TOOLS-574)

h4. Changes in euca2ools 3.2.1
* This release includes a new euca2ools.ini man page, which documents euca2ools configuration files.
* euare-accountcreate no longer requires an account name.  Note that account names are still required by eucalyptus 4.1 and earlier.  To add a name to an account that lacks one, use euare-accountaliascreate.  (TOOLS-557)
* euca-describe-snapshots no longer sends requests that filter by snapshots' owners or restorers when asked to describe a list of specific snapshots.  (TOOLS-547)
* euca-run-instances now accepts a --associate-public-ip-address option, which allows one to override the subnet's settings for whether or not new instances are assigned public IP addresses.  (TOOLS-553)

comments.body:
Confirmed with Garrett that these Euca2ools bug fixes will be released with 4.1.2 release:
3.1.3 (circa 2014) is the minus 1 of Euca2ools
3.2.1 (circa 2015) is the current version of Euca2ools

[~kmeredith] will create the Euca2ools release notes (resolved issues et al) based on this ticket.
TBD if [~scottb] or Keri will update the Euca2ools Guide for the content of the related tickets (i.e., the command changes).

Hi [~gholms] are there ticket #s associated with these 3 items?
# euare-rolecreate --service is now read from the command line correctly.
# EC2 no longer requires special privileges to use euca-bundle-image's and euca-install-image's --virtualization-type options. Those commands' documentation now reflects that.
# This release includes a new euca2ools.ini man page, which documents euca2ools configuration files.
[~scottb] I need help on the actual changes to the euca2ools commands - as described in these 9-10 tickets.
No, those changes do not have jira issues associated with them.

h4. Updates in docs to support the command changes:
h5. Changes in euca2ools 3.2.1 and euca2ools 3.1.3
* euca-bundle-image (TOOLS-559) - no doc impact (bug fix)
* euare-accountgetsummary --as-account option (TOOLS-554) - commit 3f37d06 by Scott
* euca-authorize and euca-revoke (TOOLS-560) - commit 5b45e24 by Scott
* euare-rolecreate --service is now read from the command line correctly. - no doc impact (bug fix)
* euca-bundle-image's and euca-install-image's --virtualization-type options. Those commands' documentation now reflects that. - *Note:* http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/euca2ools-guide/euca-bundle-image.html does not have -- virtualization-type option; http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/euca2ools-guide/euca-install-image.html has been updated; both have been cleaned up a bit. - see commit ac7409a by Keri
* Account registration status will be removed from eucalyptus 4.2 euare-usermod (EUCA-9481) - Removed from the MASTER BRANCH (only) http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/euca2ools-guide/euare-usermod.html - see commit 88bfc6a by Keri

h5. Changes in euca2ools 3.2.1
* new euca2ools.ini man page, which documents euca2ools configuration files. - What's New - feature list - see http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#euca2ools-release-notes/rn_euca2ools_features_3.2.1.html
* euare-accountcreate (TOOLS-557) - commit 0438dc5 by Scott
* euca-describe-snapshots (TOOLS-547) - no doc impact (there was nothing noted about this in either http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#euca2ools-guide/euca-describe-snaphots.html or http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#euca2ools-guide/euca-describe-images.html ) - *please CONFIRM this is OK* (don't know what happens if I do include extra params - error or ignore?)
* euca-run-instances --associate-public-ip-address option (TOOLS-553) - commit 5c2e976 by Keri - see http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#euca2ools-guide/euca-run-instances.html

Oops.  --virtualization-type is for euca-register and euca-install-image.

Account registration status will not be removed from any version of euca2ools, so please do not remove it from any version of the euca2ools guide.  The only change is simply documenting that that option will not work with eucalyptus 4.2 and later.

TOOLS-547 has no documentation impact apart from being a bugfix that can go into the release notes.

euca-run-instances --associate-public-ip-address will override the subnet's settings, whether it is given "true" or "false".  In particular, this means that one can use this to run instances with no public addresses in a subnet that assigns them by default.

Hi [~gholms] Please review (or delegate) the updated docs:

A. Changes in euca2ools 3.2.1 and euca2ools 3.1.3
# euca-bundle-image (TOOLS-559) - no doc impact (bug fix)
# euare-accountgetsummary --as-account option (TOOLS-554) - commit 3f37d06 by Scott - see [euare-accountgetsummary|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/euca2ools-guide/euare-accountgetsummary.html]
# euca-authorize and euca-revoke (TOOLS-560) - commit 5b45e24 by Scott - see [euca-authorize|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/euca2ools-guide/euca-authorize.html] and [euca-revoke|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/euca2ools-guide/euca-revoke.html]
# euare-rolecreate --service is now read from the command line correctly. - no doc impact (bug fix)
# euca-bundle-image's and euca-install-image's --virtualization-type options. - commit ac7409a by Keri - see [euca-install-image|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/euca2ools-guide/euca-install-image.html] (also general updates to:
[euca-bundle-image|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/euca2ools-guide/euca-bundle-image.html]
[euca-bundle-vol|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/euca2ools-guide/euca-bundle-vol.html] )
# Account registration status removed from eucalyptus 4.2 euare-usermod (EUCA-9481) - commit 88bfc6a by Keri - MASTER BRANCH [euare-usermod|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/euca2ools-guide/euare-usermod.html]

B. Changes in euca2ools 3.2.1
# new euca2ools.ini man page, which documents euca2ools configuration files. - see [What's New|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#euca2ools-release-notes/rn_euca2ools_features_3.2.1.html]
# euare-accountcreate (TOOLS-557) - commit 0438dc5 by Scott - see [euare-accountcreate|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/euca2ools-guide/euare-accountcreate.html]
# euca-describe-snapshots (TOOLS-547) - no doc impact (there was nothing noted about this behavior in either [euca-describe-snapshots|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#euca2ools-guide/euca-describe-snaphots.html] or [euca-describe-images|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#euca2ools-guide/euca-describe-images.html] ) - don't know what happens if I _do_ include extra params - error or ignore?; made minor updates in these docs.
# euca-run-instances --associate-public-ip-address option (TOOLS-553) - commit 5c2e976 by Keri - see [euca-run-instances|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#euca2ools-guide/euca-run-instances.html]
[~gholms] I guess I had my last comment in draft and so missed your just-prior notes. Will review them now.
[~gholms] updated euca-register; restored reg-status; sent you google doc on associate-public-ip-address option description. Otherwise, see comments above.

Try these:

|--reg-status|Status of the user's registration.  This option is specific to Eucalyptus 4.1 and earlier, in which only confirmed users may access the system.|

|--associate-public-ip-address _value_|(VPC only) Whether or not to assign public IP addresses to the new instances.  This overrides the subnet’s settings for whether or not to assign them by default.|

Hi [~gholms] - made the 2 changes above; 
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/euca2ools-guide/euare-usermod.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#euca2ools-guide/euca-run-instances.html

Updated the release notes (don't know what to do with the issues w/o TOOLS-nnn ticket #s - should we create a ticket or 2?).
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#euca2ools-release-notes/rn_euca2ools_resolved_3.2.1.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#euca2ools-release-notes/rn_euca2ools_resolved_3.1.3.html

Please let me know if you have any further updates for euca2ools. thanks, kjm
[~gholms] OK to call this resolved yet? (any more updates to euca2ools?)

[~gholms] - A few questions for you please:
# See http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#euca2ools-release-notes/rn_euca2ools_resolved_3.2.1.html - I added TOOLS-561 since it shows as fixed in 3.2.1. Let me know if there was some reason you left it off your list?
# Still do not know what to do with the last two items on the release notes (showing as "TOOLS-nnn" since there are no Jira tickets for the fixes). What have you done with these types of issues in the past?
# See http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#release-notes/4.1.2/4.1.2_rn_resolved.html - Also have the TOOLS tickets on the Euca (rather than euca2ools) release notes - should they stay or go?

1.  TOOLS-561 was not resolved in euca2ools 3.2.1.  It was a bug discovered during 3.3.0 development and fixed during 3.3.0 development.
2.  Those have no issues associated with them, so I would just leave those blank unless there is a pressing need to require them.
3.  I am not entirely sure what you are asking, but the table you linked to does not appear to contain TOOLS issues, which is good, because those would be redundant.

Thanks, [~gholms]! Updated per #1 and #2. Re #3, I decided to remove them since DOC-1608 is on that list.
So I think this ticket is now resolved! kjm

Here's one more issue for 3.1.3 and 3.2.1:

* euca-upload-bundle's --skipmanifest option now works correctly.  (TOOLS-574)

Related to DOC-1471, made tweaks to euca-authorize and euca-revoke the other day.

Added euca-upload-bundle fix to release notes just now.
[~gholms] I will assume no news is good news and call this resolved again! thanks, kjm
